result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L. Bartlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with co-defendants. 
Absolute sobriety - random UA testing to be done.

Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
May transfer to county of residence. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

May transfer to county of residence.

Plea hearing on June 24, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

AMENDED No contact with co-defendant(s):  G.C.; D.W.; S.Y.; T.P.; A.A. May have contact with female co-dendant(s) while in jail but cannot discuss the case.  Court allows contact with finance co-defendant Sou Yang - as long as it's not about the case.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report.
